required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Risk Factors and Impact of Anesthesia Techniques on Myocardial Infarction Following Transurethral Resection of the Prostate
clinical_study.official_title: Risk Factors and Impact of Anesthesia Techniques on Myocardial Infarction Following Transurethral Resection of the Prostate: a Nationwide Database Case Control Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study examined the risk factors and the influence of the type of anesthetic used during transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP) on subsequent incidence of myocardial infarction (MI).

detailed_description.textblock: This study utilized a population-based, nationwide dataset to evaluate the risk factors of MI for patients with benign prostate hypertrophy (BPH) who received TURP. Besides, The study also compared the different effects of general anesthesia (GA) and neuraxial anesthesia (NA) on the incidence of MI within 6 and 12 months after TURP.

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative myocardial infarction
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 6 months after the first admission for TURP
primary_outcome.description: Patients experienced myocardial infarction after transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP)

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative myocardial infarction
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 12 months after the first admission for TURP
primary_outcome.description: Patients experienced myocardial infarction after transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP)

arm_group.description: Patients without post-operative myocardial infarction after first admission for transurethral resection of the prostate
Patients with post-operative myocardial infarction after first admission for transurethral resection of the prostate

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients receiving TURP surgery (1998-2012)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients without anesthesia records
- Patients receiving both general and neuraxial anesthesia
- Mortality within 12 months of TURP
